Definition: In this task, you will be given a short story with five sentences. The second sentence will be missing, and you will be given two options to choose from. You need to select the option that best connects the first sentence with the rest of the story. If the first option is correct, indicate your answer with 'Option 1'. If the first option is not correct, 'Option 2' is the correct answer. The incorrect option will change the subsequent storyline, so that at least one of the three subsequent sentences is no longer consistent with the story.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Positive Examples.explanation: Option 1 forms a consistent story with the given four sentences. In constrast, Option 2 is incorrect as the entty 'two dogs' is not consistent with 'men' mentioned in Sentence 4.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Three men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two men rushed into the hospital.
Positive Examples.explanation: Option 1 forms a consistent story with the given four sentences. In constrast, Option 2 is incorrect as it is not consisitent with sentence 1 ('store cashier' vs 'hospital').

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.  
 Option 1:  Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Option 2: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Negative Examples.output: Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up.
Negative Examples.explanation: The selected option is correct but it outputed the entire option text instead of its label i.e 'Option 1'.

Instances.input:
Sentence 1: We went deep sea fishing on a vacation. 
 Sentence 3: When we finally started fishing, I caught a huge flounder 
 Sentence 4:  They cut it up for us and we took it home to eat 
 Sentence 5:  It was some of the best fish I've ever had 
 Option 1: We went all the way out in the ocean looking for fish. 
 Option 2: His father is out in the ocean looking for fish.

Sentence 1: John needed to create a new presentation for his job. 
 Sentence 3: John did not meet the deadline 
 Sentence 4:  As a result his presentation was incomplete 
 Sentence 5:  John was fired from the job 
 Option 1: John immediately came up with new ideas. 
 Option 2: John struggled to come up with new ideas.

Sentence 1: Jeb mowed lawns all summer long. 
 Sentence 3: In the fall he had amassed quite a small fortune 
 Sentence 4:  He took all the money to the local pawn shop 
 Sentence 5:  There, he bought back the ring his mom had sold to buy food 
 Option 1: He blew his money every weekend at the local arcade. 
 Option 2: He saved up all the cash from his work and his allowance.

Sentence 1: I entered a raffle to win ten thousand dollars. 
 Sentence 3: I spent five thousand dollars on raffle tickets 
 Sentence 4:  When my name wasn't called, I felt awful 
 Sentence 5:  After that I never gambled again 
 Option 1: I really wanted to win. 
 Option 2: I got a free ticket.

Sentence 1: Leroy was excited to get his paycheck. 
 Sentence 3: He paid off some bills 
 Sentence 4:  Then he paid for some necessities 
 Sentence 5:  Before he knew it Leroy's paycheck was gone 
 Option 1: For some reason they delayed it though. 
 Option 2: Once it was deposited into his bank account he started spending it.

Sentence 1: Paul didn't know who to vote for in the presidential election. 
 Sentence 3: Paul took note of important topics discussed 
 Sentence 4:  After doing more research online, he finally decided 
 Sentence 5:  Paul felt good making an informed decision 
 Option 1: He decided to watch the presidential debate. 
 Option 2: So he picked a guy at random.

Sentence 1: Sarah's long finger nails were bothering her. 
 Sentence 3: A few minutes later, her mom gave her a canned soda 
 Sentence 4:  But she couldn't open it 
 Sentence 5:  She regret cutting her nails so short 
 Option 1: So she decided to cut them really short. 
 Option 2: So she decided to cut them to a practical length.

Sentence 1: Ann hated chores, especially washing dishes. 
 Sentence 3: She saw how hard and tiring it was to wash dishes constantly 
 Sentence 4:  She went home and saw her poor mom struggling to do the same thing 
 Sentence 5:  After that, Ann did the dishes every day without being asked 
 Option 1: She told her mom she wasn't going to do any chores anymore. 
 Option 2: But she took a job as a dishwasher after school to earn money.
